item.title: OpenAI
item.description:
OpenAI

OpenAI is a non-profit artificial intelligence research company. Our goal is to advance digital intelligence in the way that is most likely to benefit humanity as a whole, unconstrained by a need to generate financial return. Since our research is free from financial obligations, we can better focus on a positive human impact.

item.title: Sony's Ear Puts an AI Inside Your, Er, Ear
item.description:
Sony's Ear Puts an AI Inside Your, Er, Ear

Sony clearly watched Joaquin Phoenix in Her. Its latest announcement is an earpiece that interacts with your phone to inject the sweet mutterings of an AI straight into your skull. Welcome to the future. Just how "artificially intelligent" is it? So so.

item.title: New $5 Million X Prize for AI That Gives the Best TED Talk
item.description:
New $5 Million X Prize for AI That Gives the Best TED Talk

In 2020, three speakers will appear onstage to deliver a TED talk and compete for $5 million. But these presenters will share a unique characteristic that sets them apart from TED talkers who came before them: They won't be human.

item.title: What I learned teaching a course on artificial intelligence (and you can too)
item.description:
What I learned teaching a course on artificial intelligence (and you can too)

I recently finished teaching a free, eight-week online course on artificial intelligence and cognitive technologies. Over 7,000 students registered for the course. Many of them were active participants in rich discussions throughout the eight weeks.

item.title: Bernie knows when to swipe right
item.description:
Bernie knows when to swipe right

Meet Bernie. He talks. He swipes. He does research. Bernie is your personal matchmaking and dating assistant A.I.

item.title: Google's Go Victory Is Just a Glimpse of How Powerful AI Will Be
item.description:
Google's Go Victory Is Just a Glimpse of How Powerful AI Will Be

An artificially intelligent Google machine just beat a human grandmaster at the game of Go, the 2,500-year-old contest of strategy and intellect that's exponentially more complex than the game of chess. And Nick Bostrom isn't exactly impressed.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
Artificial Intelligence

Should we be scared of artificial intelligence and all it will bring us? Not so long as we remember to make sure to build artificial emotional intelligence into the technology.

item.title: Stephen Hawking warns artificial intelligence could end mankind - BBC News
item.description:
Stephen Hawking warns artificial intelligence could end mankind - BBC News

Prof Stephen Hawking, one of Britain's pre-eminent scientists, has said that efforts to create thinking machines pose a threat to our very existence. He told the BBC:"The development of full artificial intelligence could spell the end of the human race."

item.title: Robots and AI Invade Banking
item.description:
Robots and AI Invade Banking

No longer just the objects of fascination in science fiction, robots are beginning their invasion of banking. Robots and artificial intelligence in banking have the potential to reduce costs, expand skills, and improve the customer experience working alongside (or replacing) humans.
